channel.title: Context Engineering Daily
channel.description: Daily news and research updates in AI Context Engineering, Prompt Engineering, RAG, and LLM development

item.title: DeepRead: Document Structure-Aware Reasoning to Enhance Agentic Search
item.description: arXiv:2602.05014v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: With the rapid progress of tool-using and agentic large language models (LLMs), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is evolving from one-shot, passive retrieval into multi-turn, decision-driven evidence acquisition. Despite strong results in open-dom...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, model, framework, experiment, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: MINT: Minimal Information Neuro-Symbolic Tree for Objective-Driven Knowledge-Gap Reasoning and Active Elicitation
item.description: arXiv:2602.05048v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Joint planning through language-based interactions is a key area of human-AI teaming. Planning problems in the open world often involve various aspects of incomplete information and unknowns, e.g., objects involved, human goals/intents -- thus leading...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, reasoning, arxiv, RAG | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Evaluating Large Language Models on Solved and Unsolved Problems in Graph Theory: Implications for Computing Education
item.description: arXiv:2602.05059v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models are increasingly used by students to explore advanced material in computer science, including graph theory. item.title: Towards Reducible Uncertainty Modeling for Reliable Large Language Model Agents
item.description: arXiv:2602.05073v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Uncertainty quantification (UQ) for large language models (LLMs) is a key building block for safety guardrails of daily LLM applications. Yet, even as LLM agents are increasingly deployed in highly complex tasks, most UQ research still centers on sing...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, framework, paper, LLM, arxiv | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: VERA-MH: Reliability and Validity of an Open-Source AI Safety Evaluation in Mental Health
item.description: arXiv:2602.05088v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Millions now use leading generative AI chatbots for psychological support. Despite the promise related to availability and scale, the single most pressing question in AI for mental health is whether these tools are safe. item.description: arXiv:2602.05105v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As intelligent systems and multi-agent coordination become increasingly central to real-world applications, there is a growing need for simulation tools that are both scalable and accessible. item.title: Understanding LLM Evaluator Behavior: A Structured Multi-Evaluator Framework for Merchant Risk Assessment
item.description: arXiv:2602.05110v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly used as evaluators of reasoning quality, yet their reliability and bias in payments-risk settings remain poorly understood. We introduce a structured multi-evaluator framework for assessing LLM reasoning i...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> large language model, model, framework, LLM, alignment | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." â€” Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.

item.title: ThinkSound - [NeurIPS 2025] PyTorch implementation of [ThinkSound], a unified framework for generating audio from any modality, guided by Chain-of-Thought (CoT) reasoning.

item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> LLM, context, prompt, tool, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: KAG - KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.
item.description: KAG is a logical form-guided reasoning and retrieval framework based on OpenSPG engine and LLMs. It is used to build logical reasoning and factual Q&A solutions for professional domain knowledge bases. It can effectively overcome the shortcomings of the traditional RAG vector similarity calculation model.<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> GitHub | <strong>Keywords:</strong> model, knowledge base, framework, LLM, vector | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
